text: Elmore Rual "Rip" Torn (February 6, 1931 â€“ July 9, 2019) was an American movie, television, stage, and voice actor who was known for his role as Chief Zed in Men in Black and in Men in Black II. He won an Emmy Award in 1996 for his role as Artie on the television series The Larry Sanders Show. Torn was born on February 6, 1931 in Temple, Texas. He studied at Texas A&M; University. Torn was married to Ann Wedgeworth from 1955 until they divorced in 1961. Then he was married to Geraldine Page from 1963 until her death in 1987. He married Amy Wright in 1989. He had six children. Torn died on July 9, 2019 at his home in Lakeville, Connecticut from Alzheimer's disease-related problems at the age of 88. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1931 births Category:2019 deaths Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:American stage actors Category:American voice actors Category:Actors from Texas Category:People from Temple, Texas Category:Emmy Award winning actors Category:Deaths from Alzheimer's disease
title: Rip Torn
